workExperience.description: Acquiring and managing data for multiple research projects. Developing and maintaining bespoke API and databases.
Conducting and assisting with sleep studies involving polysomnography, consumer devices, and health and cognitive testing.

education.description: Focusing on the impact of sleep and shift-work on cognitive performance using wearable and nearable technology. My research aims to understand how these factors can be measured to assist in predicting safety-critical workplace functioning.

Collaborated on government-funded Wind Farm Noise Study at Flinders University, specifically looking at actigraphic symptoms of insomnia relative to wind-turbine proximity. Graduated with First-Class Honours & University Medal.
Bachelor of Behavioural Science (Psychology). Dual-major in psychology and philosophy. Graduated with Chancellor's Letter of Commendation.

research.title: [1] Manners et al. (2022)
research.description: The Good Sleeper Scale-15 items: a questionnaire for the standardised assessment of good sleepers.

research.title: [2] Manners et al. (2022)
research.description: Predicting vigilance in a shift-work context with under-mattress sensor data from the preceding sleep.

research.title: [3] Guyett et al. (2022)
research.description: Investigation of a novel LED lighting strategy designed to accelerate circadian entrainment to night shift-work in an encapsulated environment.

research.title: [4] Stuart et al. (2022)
research.description: A pilot study of a novel electrode system for brainwave acquisition during sleep: Tripolar Concentric Ring Electrodes.

research.title: [5] Scott et al. (2022)
research.description: Emerging applications of objective sleep assessments towards the improved management of insomnia.
